argument.description: The string to trim from the right-hand side.
The set of characters that will be removed from the right-hand side of string. If this parameter is omitted, the rtrim function will remove space characters from the right-hand side of string.

description: The PostgreSQL rtrim function removes all specified characters from the right-hand side of a string.
sample:
postgres=# SELECT rtrim('  techonthenet.com  ', ' ');
       rtrim
----------------------
 '  techonthenet.com'
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT rtrim('   Tech   on   the   net   ');
          rtrim
----------------------------
 '   Tech   on   the   net'
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT rtrim('techonthenet.com    ');
      rtrim
--------------------
 'techonthenet.com'
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT rtrim('123000', '0');
 rtrim
-------
 '123'
(1 row)
